author: Special Correspondent
text:
Passengers can either downloadNational Train Enquiry System app or SMS 139

At Chennai Central, passengers no longer have to hop from one platform to another searching for the train they have to board.

Southern Railway on Friday launched an initiative whereby passengers can receive an alert on their mobile phone about the platform from which their train will depart.

While passengers with smartphones can download the National Train Enquiry System (NTES) app, those without data connection can also learn about the platform number well in advance by sending a short messaging service (SMS) to the helpline 139, a press release said.

According to officials, the station master decides the platform for each train departing from Chennai Central and as soon as it is done, the details will be fed to the NTES terminal. The terminal, the officials said, was now placed near the station master’s office so that the information was uploaded immediately.

When passengers entered the train number, the platform number would be displayed immediately.

Officials said that they had launched the new system for trains leaving Chennai Central, but would gradually extend it to other major stations.

Users who tried the NTES app said they were able to receive details about the platform numbers of trains leaving from Egmore too.

Officials said the app would show the platform numbers of trains departing from Egmore, but it was not complete.

They said that passengers could get information about the platform numbers by sending an SMS in the following format: AD (train No.) 044 (STD code of Chennai), an official press release said.
title: Now, platform number alert on your phone
